Josh / Linux / Scripts / LatexTidy

LatexTidy

Download

When building latex documents, I use latexmk since it has a built in option to watch for file changes and build the document when it detects one. But, as with any latex compiler, this produces a large number of auxilary files, relating to the table of contents, images etc. These are all ignored with a .gitignore file, but sometimes its nice to clean a directory up, for which I use this sciprt.

All it does is search through a directory and search for files with the specified extensions and delete them. It has options to do this recursively, incase you've got a number of folders with redundant latex files in, and a dry-run option to display which files would be deleted if it was run normally.
